title: Scottish independence: 15 to days to referendum - as it happened | Politics | The Guardian
summary: lloyds may move hq to london .

text: a former member of the parachute regiment says that if scotland becomes independent then it could not defend itself for a moment against a sizeable attack .
he wants to know what the yes side 's ' 'plan b ' is on defence .
harvie responds by saying that the challenges and threats faced by scotland in today 's world are not similar to those of the past .
no invading army is on its borders .
today 's threats are about global challenges and social justice .
ok then , we 're going to leave them to it now and wrap up today 's live blog for now .
a new one beckons bright and early .
thanks for reading .
an audience member wants to know what would happen if there was a no vote in scotland and then a yes vote for the uk to leave the european union .
harvie says that scotland needs to have a seat at the table , once again raising the prospect of tory and ukip pacts and coalitions .
davidson says she wants to stay in the eu but wants a better deal for it .
most scots , even snp voters '' want that better deal '' as well .
however , she adds , if the tories win the next election which frankly is not likely by the polls but we are trying our best '' , then the chance to realise that deal will be realisable .
davidson says there are very few countries who have unilaterally given up nuclear weapons , adding ukraine is one of those .
this week vladimir putin said that his troops could be in kiev in two weeks .
that 's why we need nuclear weapons , '' she says .
harvie says it 's pretty astonishing that scots are being told that they need to worry about vladimir putin as well .
into the third round now - scotland 's place in the world and trident .
tory leader ruth davidson opens up by praising the role played by tony blair to reduce nuclear weapons .
the snp 's plans do nothing to make the world a safer place , '' she says , adding that it 's crucial to work with others rather than disarm on a unilateral basis .

green msp patrick harvie says that if scotland forces the hand of the uk government on the strategic case '' then it can tip the balance in favour of those campaigning for disarmament south of the border as well .
ponsonby puts smith on the spot and asks her if she agrees with the snp 's plans to cut corporation tax three percent below the uk rate .
i 'm not a politician now , '' she says , getting a few laughs , adding at this stage she is is not sure if she agrees .
better together ( @ uk together ) elaine c smith pans snp 's own plan for a big business tax cut .
# scotdecides saoirse ( @ zer0deconduit ) loving elaine c smith .
kezia back on snp bad .
says she hates cutting corporation tax gordon brown cut it twice .
rank hypocrisy .
# stvdebate
question from the audience - are the two really disagreeing ?
what unites them ?
smith emphasises her support for social justice and says that independence is not a magic wand to make changes .
it 's a start - it 's about not leaving it to politicians , '' she adds .
dugdale says she would be voting for an independent country if that was the way to achieve a fairer , more social democratic society , but it 's not .
i do n't come this as some sort of die heard unionist .
i 'm voting in scotland 's interests and that 's why i 'm voting 'no thanks ' . ''
getting rather heated now .
smith says that dugdale just wants everyone to vote labour , get to the back of the bus and shut up . ''
dugdale says smith thinks it 's about boundaries and constitutions - it 's not it 's about where power lies ''
the debate has moved into the issues of social justice and welfare , with kezia dugdale squaring off against elaine c smith .
dugdale accused the snp in parliament of voting down the opportunity to put in place a living wage , and i think that was a scandal '' .
smith says there wo n't be much difference between the two sides about the need for social justice - it 's about how to effect it .
it 's crucial , she says however , for the elevers of power to be edinburgh rather than in london .
also libby brooks ( @ libby brooks ) elaine c gets in a nice # patronisingbtlady gag already # scotlanddecides

documents.title: lloyds may move hq to london
text: here 's a story which broke earlier this evening ( the debate is in a break now ) - banking industry sources have told reuters that lloyds banking group is considering having its registered office in london rather than edinburgh should scots vote for independence .
reuters reports : lloyds , which owns bank of scotland , has finalised contingency planning ahead of the sept. 18 vote .
the chances of secession have increased with support for scottish independence rising dramatically in august .
audience members want to know if alexander will continue to oppose '' scotland using the pound in the event of independence .
he says that of course he would accept the decision of the scottish people , their sovereign will , but the difference is that it ca n't bind what would be a separate country after independence .
if we make this choice to be independent , what then are the realistic choices ?
i do n't believe that a currency union is in scotland 's interests .
sturgeon 's squeezing in the references to westminster tories , warning that george osborne is preparing for further cuts .

if our budget continues to be at the mercy of westminster it 's going to be harder to protect the things that we want to protect alexander references recent forecasts by the office for budget responsibility on future uk and scotland revenues , adding : we wo n't be getting away from austerity if we vote for independence - we will be voting for austerity plus .

douglas alexander says it 's a fact that norway 's reserves are about twice the reserves of the uk he adds that it 's also a fact that every single penny '' of the tax revenue from scotland 's oil is being used today to fund scotland 's schools and hospitals .
alexander says that someone starting primary school now are going to see oil revenues falling dramatically by the time they go into the jobs .
nicola sturgeon , after referencing norway 's oil fund , says : anyone who thinks the oil is running out only needs to go to shetland .
no other country would see oil as a bonus or a burden .
douglas alexander says the fact is that during his lifetime the price of oil has been extremely volatile .
it 's not the icing on the cake its an absolutely fundamental part of sustaining scotland into the future , '' he adds of the role played by oil in scotland 's economy .
alexander references the intervention in the referendum debate by sir iain wood , who suggested that the scottish government had overestimated scotland 's remaining oil stocks .
a question now from an audience member about north sea oil stocks .
he wants to know how an independent scotland plan to retain services when , he says , the oil stocks are declining .
sturgeon says that oil is not the basis of the economy .
it 's a fantastic resource .
it 's not a question of whether scotland has oil - it 's a question of whether scotland has lots of oil or lots and lots of oil .
most countries would give their eye teeth to be in that position , '' she says .
this debate has captured scotland 's imagination , says nicola sturgeon , who adds that different visions will be put forward tonight about what an independent scotland can achieve .
no one has ever run the affairs of this country better than the people who live here , says sturgeon , who then adds that in 1977 scotland got margaret thatcher and the poll tax .
only an independent scotland would rid the country of nuclear weapons , she says .

opening up for the no side , douglas alexander says that there are just days to go before an irreversible decision , and yet nationalists can not answer basic questions the alternative , which he says he supports , is for decisions to be taken here in scotland by scots with a stronger scottish parliament .

tonight 's debate - which takes place at the assembly rooms in edinburgh - is a different type of debate '' to the head to head clashes of alex salmond and alastair darling , says presenter bernard ponsonby .
yes scotland have won the toss and are making the opening statement .

documents.title: scotland and the euro
text: ahead of the debate , here 's an update on another front .

the former commissioner for monetary union has said it would not be possible for an independent scotland to join the eu if it tried to use the pound without the formal currency deal that all three uk parties have repeatedly vetoed .

severin carrell and katie allen report : olli rehn , who stood down in july as the european commissioner for the monetary union and the euro , wrote to danny alexander , the chief secretary of the treasury , this week to say it would not be possible because scotland would not have a currency backed by a central bank .

in his letter rehn wrote that alex salmond 's sterlingisation '' plan to use the pound without the formal permission of london would simply not be possible , since that would obviously imply a situation where the candidate country concerned would not have a monetary authority of its own and thus no necessary instruments of the emu '' [ economic and monetary union ] .

the evening intervention came as pound fell to a five-month low against the us dollar and also weakened against the euro on tuesday hours after a yougov poll showed for the first time that the yes campaign needed only a three-point swing to win the independence referendum .
with the vote due in just over two weeks , it showed support for independence now standing at 47 % .
olli rehn said scotland would not be able to join because it would not have a currency backed by its own independent central bank .
vanden wijngaert/ap
good evening .
i 'm at tonight 's stv 'town hall ' debate in edinburgh , which kicks off in the next 30 minutes .
it 's three against three with the opposing sides comprising of : yes .
nicola sturgeon , the deputy first minister , .
patrick harvie , scottish green party co-convenor and msp .
elaine c smith , actress and scottish independence convention chair no .
douglas alexander , the shadow foreign secretary .
ruth davidson , the scottish conservative leader .
kezia dugdale , labour msp and shadow education secretary in the scottish parliament .
stephen townsend ( @ stephentowns10 ) stage being set for stv 's second live referendum debate .
tune in at 8pm .
# scotdecides # indyref

documents.title: summary of key events
text: support for scottish independence has risen by eight points in the last month , in a poll described as a breakthrough '' by yes campaigners .
the yougov poll released on monday night put the lead for the no campaign at six points , down from 14 points in the middle of august and 22 points early last month..
the pound fell in nervous trading after the poll showed record support for scottish independence just over a fortnight before the referendum .
sterling fell against the dollar and even against the euro after a yougov poll showed support for the pro-independence yes campaign had risen..

competing claims about levels of voter registration in scotland have cast doubt on the idea that a missing million '' of previously unregistered voters could swing the referendum result in favour of independence .
on monday , scotland 's first minister , alex salmond warned unregistered voters that they had just 24 hours left to sign up to take part in scotland 's date with destiny '' .
voters have until midnight on tuesday to register for the independence referendum on 18 september .

i 'm going to wrap things up here now for now but the plan is to bring coverage to you later from tonight 's live referendum debate between nicola sturgeon , patrick harvie , elaine c smith , douglas alexander , ruth davidson and kezia dugdale .
peter kellner of yougov has predicted a second referendum if the no vote narrowly wins .
he says that alex salmond has also started to neutralise the 'fear factor ' of voting yes .
commenting on his company 's poll , he also says that the yes campaign has managed to gain converts and secured a two-to-one leader among people who were undecided and have now taken sides .
kellner writes in the guardian ( the full version is here ) : what explains these shifts ?
a major factor concerns attitudes to the economy .
from time to time we ask people whether they think scotland would be better or worse off if it became independent .
just nine weeks ago , in late june , pessimists outnumbered optimists by 49 % to 27 % .
now the gap is far narrower : 44 % to 35 % .
again , the biggest movement has been among labour supporters .
but it 's not just the economy .
the yes campaign is also boosted by widespread fears that if scotland stays in the uk , the nhs in scotland would get worse .
only 9 % think it would improve .
on the other hand , more people think an independent scotland would ensure the nhs improves ( 37 % ) rather than deteriorates ( 27 % ) .
the pound has fallen in nervous trading after a poll showed record support for scottish independence just over a fortnight before the referendum .
katie allen reports : sterling fell against the dollar and even against the euro after a yougov poll showed support for the pro-independence yes campaign had risen to 47 % .
the lead held by the no campaign has fallen to six points from 22 points at the start of august .
traders said the pound was likely to weaken further ahead of the 18 september referendum .
the future of the pound in an independent scotland has been a central part of the debate in the lead up to the vote .
the scottish first minister , alex salmond , insists scotland will continue to use the pound if it votes for independence .
but all three main political parties at westminster have said an independent scotland would not be allowed to continue to use sterling .
some last minute vote registering stuart crawford ( @ potatojunkie ) the queue to register to vote is currently running out the door # glasgow # indyref

here 's a tweeted of alex samond at the new eden mill distillery and brewery in st andews earlier , where he was setting out his vision of the potential gains of independence for the food and drink sector .
eden brewery ( @ edenbrewery ) a signed cask !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # distillery # foodanddrink
a bit more on the donations report from earlier , courtesy of libby brooks .

the yes scotland campaign received a funding boost from the proclaimers today , after electoral commission figures confirmed that the pro-union better together campaign has stopped taking donations after reaching its £ 1.5m funding limit .

better together appealed for individuals to stop sending them money after being flooding with donations following alastair darling 's strong performance in the first televised debate in early august .

donations to the official pro-independence campaign for the most recent reporting period from 25 july to 21 august included £ 50,000 from elizabeth topping , the wife of the former williams hill chief executive ralph topping , and £ 75,000 from randall foggie , an snp council candidate from kirkcaldy .
a longer piece will be online in a wee bit .
today 's yougov poll might just provide the 'kick up the arse ' which the better together campaign needed , says alex massie in the spectator .
he writes : perhaps voters will flirt with divorce before deciding that , actually , their marriage deserves another go .
but , again , that 's not something that can be taken for granted .
it has never been , of course , which leaves one to wonder why so many did take it for granted for so long ?
reacting to the latest polls , downing street has said the only one that matters is the actual vote and insisted there would be no change in tactics .

the prime minister 's official spokesman said : there is n't a change here in the approach that the government has been or will be taking , which is , in summary , real confidence in the argument that the government and others are making .
we have always said from the outset that there is never room for complacency but of course the only poll that counts is the referendum itself .
the spokesman insisted that senior members of the government had been making the case for the union directly in scotland or elsewhere in the uk '' over recent months .
i just need to re-locate now .
i 'll be back as soon as possible .
so is it really game on after that latest referendum poll by yougov finding that the no lead is down to six points from more than 20 in early august ?
scottish independence polling by yougov .
guardian alberto nardelli , the guardian 's data editor , has been taking a look and comes up with four reasons why the narrowing gap is significant .

a open letter to england has been published by english scots for a yes vote , starting with the words : dear england , during the course of this referendum campaign , you have been told many distortions of the truth and fabrications about scotland and why people in scotland are voting yes .

it goes on to say : as english people involved in the independence movement , we feel we are confident in saying that sentiment against english people has been virtually non-existent in our movement .
what people in scotland want to escape is the westminster regime , not the english people .
you can read it here .

the guardian 's michael white was also at jim murphy 's 100 towns '' campaign tour today , where the labour mp admitted that the no campaigner have a fight on their hands after new polls showed the yes side closing the gap by 6 per cent in marked contrast to the first minister , who predicted a yes win in perth on monday night , murphy repeatedly said : i am confident we can win . ''
he later told reporters : we have a long way to go '' but that most labour voters - and , he claimed , a quarter of snp voters - will reject the independence option .

murphy called it the quiet patriotism of the majority who go about their lives and do not shout '' - a reference to demonstrators who forced him to halt his tour food three days , not through cowardice , murphy said , but over concern about public order .
we are confident , they are arrogant .
let the guys who are in last place say 'we will win ' and the guys who are in first place say 'we can win ' . ''

the next two weeks would prove more important than the last two years of the independence campaign he predicted - saying labour had worked harder for a no result since june than if does in a general election .
of the aggressive heckling last week he said : who ever turned on that noisy tap of aggressive behaviour has quietly turned it off again .
i congratulate them . ''
just taking a wee break now for a bite to eat .
back in a bit .

competing claims about levels of voter registration in scotland have cast doubt on the idea that a missing million '' of previously unregistered voters could swing the referendum result in favour of independence .
severin carrell and libby have just filed a story on that issue , which will be online later ( update : here it is now ) .

here 's a snatch : alex salmond estimated at the weekend that 180,000 new voters had now signed up , but scottish government officials said there was no official source for the first minister 's figure ; it was based on an extrapolation from new voter figures released by some councils .
even so , there was clear evidence that there has been a huge increase in people signing up to vote . ''
the number of voters signed up as of the beginning of august was 4,166,683 , indicating that over a million potential voters remain off the register .
but whether significant numbers of them have registered over the past month , and whether a critical mass of those will be voting yes , remains in dispute .
natalie bennett , green party of england and wales , is in edinburgh today explaining why her party supports the scottish greens ' push for a yes vote .
she said : scotland voting yes represents an opportunity to show that there is an alternative to the unfair austerity , social division and privatisation pursued by westminster .
i look forward to the exciting possibility of real change for england and wales that scottish independence would bring .
the scottish greens are helping the yes campaign reach out way beyond the snp , and are giving momentum to the causes of fairness , democracy and peace .
the uk 's tired old political framework is in serious need of a shake up , and a yes vote would undoubtedly do that .
here 's the latest round-up of referendum news from stephen paton , creator of the # indyref weekly review .
this week it 's scotland 's resources and scotland 's poverty .

more ( via severin carrell ) on the latest details of donations : a spokesman for yes scotland said the campaign , which has a spending limit of £ 1.5m on non-staff costs for the 16 week official campaign , was still seeking donations with barely two weeks to go .

better together said early in august it had stopped taking donations after a surge in donors following alistair darling 's narrow victory over alex salmond in the stv referendum debate on 5 august , because it had reached its £ 1.5m limit .
a yes scotland spokesman said : this is a campaign which has been going for more than two and a half years .
as money comes in , a lot of it has been accounted for already and has been spent .
we 're not in the happy condition that the no campaign has been in where they 've pots of it , and do n't need more .

lorna gordon of bbc news tweets : lorna gordon ( @ lornajg ) the treasury head civil servant has said that the department has 'contingency plans about contingency plans ' if a yes vote in # indyref so there we are then .
er crystal clear .
the vote no borders campaign were quick to put out a statement after the release of the latest donations report today , which recorded that it had received three donations in august .

the statement names the three businessmen who made the donations ( scottish , state educated and from working class backgrounds '' the statement says ) - malcolm offord , kenny greig and alan macfarlane .
grieg said : i do n't want to be considered a foreigner when i visit london on business and to see my eldest children , nor my wife to become a foreigner here in edinburgh .
as a family we are scottish and british .
i was just speaking in the cafe of the scottish national gallery to a young chap with a 'no ' badge on while i was updating the blog after jim murphy 's appearance .
he said that he and other no supporters in edinburgh had received emails encouraging them to attend the event today , something he said had n't happened to that extent before .

documents.title: donations and loans
text: the latest list of pre-poll donations and loans has just been published - showing that £ 253,000 in donations were made to registered campaigners during the period from july 25 to august 21 .

it lists four registered campaigners with reportable donations : yes - business for scotland ltd £ 10,000 - yes scotland ( designated lead campaigner ) £ 168,000 no - let 's stay together £ 25,000 - no borders campaign £ 50,000 twenty seven registered campaigners submitted a declaration that they had no reportable donations .
there were no donations that should have been reported in a previous publication .
one registered campaigner - cumbria broadband rural and community projects limited - reported a loan of £ 12,800 .
it 's the third of the electoral commission 's pre-poll donations and loans reports .
alex salmond 's going to pledge later today to work with the scottish food and drink industry to help it capitalise on the global publicity which would be generated in the event of independence .

speaking ahead of a visit to new whisky distiller in st andrew 's , the first minister said the publicity generated by a yes vote , the independence process and independence day itself would be an opportunity of a lifetime '' .

following a yes vote we will sit down with industry and scotland food and drink to discuss how we can supplement that plan to take full advantage of the unprecedented global focus on scotland , creating thousands of jobs in scotland and boosting our exports .

eden mill brewery and distillery owner paul miller says he is going to present salmond with the cask which will contain the first whisky to be distilled at the new brewery , adding : we hope that it will mature in the same way as scotland matures from the 18th of september onwards .

i 've just been listening to jim murphy , who was making his first appearance on his pro-union speaking tour of scotland after temporarily suspending it because of escalating intimidation the better together campaign claims comes from yes scotland groups .
he was outside the scottish national gallery .
no eggs this time , just one heckler who went quiet after a couple of police officers moved in his direction ( but did n't take any action ) .
murphy was surrounded on all sides by supporters , many carrying little 'no ' signs , though there were some yes supporters there , including a woman carrying a saltire with 'yes ' on it .
ben quinn ( @ benquinn75 ) some yes supporters here also .
good natured banter among crowd # indyref i 've just popped into the gallery to use the wifi and bring you this update ( hopefully a full scale riot is n't breaking out as we speak ) .
here 's a bit more of a visual sense of things : feathery update : scotland news ( @ bbcscotlandnews ) jim murphy was pursued by someone in a chicken suit as he resumed his # indyref campaign tour .
the electoral commission has provided some stats on its public awareness campaign , which show that between the launch of its voter information push on monday 11 august and friday 29 august : .
100,000 ( 100,848 ) registration forms had been downloaded from its aboutmyvote.co.uk website .
almost 65,000 ( 64,199 ) voting guides had been downloaded from its aboutmyvote.co.uk website .

over 430,000 ( 431,014 ) individual people had visited its aboutmyvote.co.uk website.. over 9,000 ( 9,022 ) people had called the commission 's call centre - the majority to request postal or registration forms .
right then .
i 'm popping out to listen to some street speaking nearby .
i 'll be in touch .
yes scotland has released a statement welcoming support expressed for scottish independence by vivienne westwood at last night 's scottish fashion awards .
after being inducted into the awards ' hall of fame , the designer said : [ an independent scotland could be ] a model to us all if it could become a people-friendly society .
surely you can still have the queen and be the united kingdom , if we win , you can be our friends if you wanted , it 's up to you .
i think it 's absolutely great that almost half , it would be great if even a half , were getting the other half , a half of scottish people want democracy .
vivienne westwood at the scottish fashion awards .
hordle/rex
this is worth a listen - an audio report for germany 's deutsche welle by peter geoghegan on poverty in scotland 's oil capital , aberdeen .
with weeks to go until scotland 's historic vote on independence , aberdeen is a city transformed .
it 's scotland 's oil capital and the city 's resulting wealth is apparent .
but not everyone has benefitted from those riches .
a section of the bp etap ( eastern trough area project ) oil platform in the north sea , around 100 miles east of aberdeen , scotland buchanan/afp/getty images
a push by yes supporters on social media to push the proclaimers to the top of the download charts in the uk appears to have worked .
the pro-independence tune - which contains the line 'i ca n't understand why we let someone else rule our land ' - went to the top of the amazon singles chart last night , the scotsman reports .
it describes the 1988 song from the brothers ' sunshine on leith album as a long-time favourite among the nationalist movement .
oh , alright then
laurence janta-lipinski , a pollster at yougov , has been tweeting a bit about the latest survey results in scotland : l janta-lipinski ( @ jantalipinski ) my thoughts on # indyref poll movement .

yes `` fear of status quo '' starting to counter no `` fear of unknown '' but , crucially for yes , 1/2 l janta-lipinski ( @ jantalipinski ) 2/2 yes also have the optimistic vision that no are lacking # indyref
i had half an ear to good morning scotland , which was reporting from stirling , described at one point as a place which has changed its mind a lot politically over the decades .
a few interesting items .

it had a short debate on education and its future in the context of the referendum campaign involving professor douglas robertson a member of academics for yes , and professor hugh pennington , a member of academics together .
there was also a piece on immigration and a look at whether an independent scotland could have a different immigration policy from the uk today .

alex salmond has said that he backs an increase in the number of young people settling in scotland from abroad although uk ministers have warned that move could lead to passport checks on anyone traveling from scotland to england .
what would existing residents in scotland make of increased immigration ?

rob mcneil of the migration observatory , which studies immigration , told good morning scotland the majority of people in scotland actually want to see reduced immigration but the difference between that and the situation in england and wales is that people in scotland are less likely to support reduced immigration than england and wales .
about 58pc of people in scotland support reduced immigration but about 75pc of people in england and wales do but nonetheless that 's still a majority of people in scotland .

on a threat by home secretary teresa may that border controls could spring up between an independent scotland and the rest of the uk , stephen tierney of the centre for constitutional law at edinburgh university said this was very unlikely '' , adding : the uk would have to say : do we really want the cost of setting up those controls when there is so much convenience when there is so much in scottish english traffic ?

i think it 's unlikely but we can not envisage what negotiations are like and if they become fraught then it is not inconcievable also , there was a a bit of light relief in an interview with ciar mcallister - a comedian who will be appearing at the strling fringe he said it had been been quite hard to satirise the referendum campaign at times because the politicians have done such a good job on their own '' .
i think first it 's only been recently that we have seen that politics has been important enough to take the mickey out of in scotland .
i think that people want a different way of access the referendum
here 's some longer coverage of that new yougov poll finding that support for scottish independence has risen eight points in a month .
the no camp is now six points ahead of the yes campaign , down from 14 points in mid-august and 22 points early last month , excluding undecided voters .
the yougov poll found that , excluding do n't knows '' , 53 % of those questioned planned to vote no , while 47 % would say yes .
this compares with 57 % for no and 43 % for yes in mid-august and 61 % for no and 39 % for yes at the beginning of last month .

blair jenkins , the chief executive of yes scotland , said : this breakthrough poll shows that yes has the big momentum - it 's an all-time high for yes support in a yougov survey so far , and an eight-point swing from no to yes in just three weeks .
we only need another three-point swing to achieve a yes for scotland on 18 september .
the poll , done for the sun and the times , questioned 1,063 respondents between 28 august and 1 september .
the better together campaign director , blair mcdougall , said : we need the silent majority who back a no vote to do their bit .
whether it 's voting on the day , knocking on doors , making phone calls or speaking to friends and family , the silent majority should feel confident in speaking up .
we will not be complacent for one second and will do everything we can to secure the brightest future for scotland within the uk .
coming up - the electoral commission will be publishing its third pre-poll donations and loans report .
we 'll have coverage of that after those details are released at noon .
here 's a google map of events happening today which i 'll try to update and add to .

documents.title: press review
text: the times scotland is within touching distance of independence , according to a poll for the times .
which splashes on 'victory in reach for salmond .
the yougov poll says that the yes campaign needs only three more points to claim victory .
it puts support for independence at 47pc , against 53 pc who say they want to remain in the uk .
the telegraph the telegraph 's coverage of the referendum starts on page six , where it reports on yesterday 's comments by alastair darling as he launched a new advert campaign for the no side .
the leader of the better together campaign said separation from the uk would be a 'giant leap backwards ' .

it has a smaller story on alex salmond calling for jim murphy to withdraw claims that yes scotland was behind the disruption of the labour mp 's speaking tour the financial times the british government has no contingency plans for a vote in favour of scottish independence , reports the ft on page two .
a spokesman for the prime minister told the newspaper that officials had no details plans for what would happen in the event of a yes vote .
the scottish sun splashing on the same yougov poll which it shared with the times , the sun leads on 'splitting distance - yes 3 points from victory in poll surge . '

the guardian a report that the prime minister 's plan to fight the terrorist threat posed by the islamic state got off to a stuttering start forms the splash in the guardian , which reports inside on a warning by the chairman of the scottish police federation that campaigners and politicians should avoid 'intemperate , inflammatory and exaggerated language . ''

the scottish daily mail there is no referendum coverage on its front page , but the mail has a two page spread inside headlined 'no hiding from your debts ' which up on gordon brown 's claims that an independent scotland would be an 'international outcast ' .

the herald doubts have been raised over the role the so-called ' missing million will play in the independence vote after it emerged that there are fewer adults on the electoral register in the poorest areas of scotland than there were in 2012 , the herald reports on its front page .
it splashes on ' 'missing million ' vote doubt as support for yes surges , up the poll for the times and the sun .
the scotsman splashing on david cameron and new ant-terror laws , the scotsman up on page eight and nine with a headline : 'vote no for the sake of your children , darling tells scots ' .
ben quinn ( @ benquinn75 ) morning press highlights from scotland # indyref & today 's events map
good morning and welcome to today 's live blog .
there are just 17 days to go before voting day and residents have until midnight to to register to ensure they can have their say .
as the clock ticks down , there are signs of a last-minute rush to register .
it coincides with a new poll showing that support for scottish independence has risen eight points in a month .
